availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: I hereby certafy that Henry Wall of Ohio County applied to me for a License to Retail Liqor on the 13th of Jany 1863 for the Term of one year under the Internal Revenue laws of the united States and I told Said Wall at the time he applied to me for a License that he could commence selling Liqor from the date of his application not knowing myself at the time that he also Required a state License and I saw said Wall in Hartford afterwards trying to get his License from the collector before the License had come on and I have no Doubt in my mind that said Wall believed that he had done all that the law Required of him to do and that he did not know that a state License was necessary for him also given under my hand this 1st day of March 1865

J H Leach assistant assessor
8th Division 1st Col Dis
of Kentucky
